analysis.summary:
ISSUES
Critical:
- How It Works Page Failed: It is critical to determine the cause of the failure for the how it works page. Check for any errors in the console, network tab, or server logs to identify the issue.

issues.recommendation: It is critical to determine the cause of the failure for the how it works page. Check for any errors in the console, network tab, or server logs to identify the issue.
Although the homepage passed the test, it has the longest load time of all pages at 979.2ms. Consider optimizing images, minifying CSS and JavaScript, and reducing HTTP requests to improve load time.

issues.message: Pricing and Blog Page Load Time
issues.recommendation: Both the pricing and blog pages have fast load times of 407.8ms and 475.3ms respectively. However, there is still room for improvement, and the same optimization techniques as mentioned for the homepage can be applied.

insights: Page Load Times: All pages have load times under 1 second, which is a good indication of fast page loading. However, optimizing load times further can improve user experience and SEO rankings.

TTFB and FCP: TTFB (Time to First Byte) and FCP (First Contentful Paint) are important metrics for measuring user experience. The pricing and blog pages have fast TTFB and FCP times, indicating that content is being delivered quickly to the user.

How It Works Page: It is crucial to determine the cause of the failure for the how it works page. This could be due to server issues, database queries, or script errors. Addressing this issue can improve user experience and prevent potential loss of users.
